verses.verse: I made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with mine eyes<WH5869>; How then should I look<WH995> upon a virgin<WH1330>?
For what is the portion<WH2506> from God<WH433> above<WH4605>, And the heritage<WH5159> from the Almighty<WH7706> on high<WH4791>?
Is it not calamity<WH343> to the unrighteous<WH5767>, And disaster<WH5235> to the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>?
Doth not he see<WH7200> my ways<WH1870>, And number<WH5608> all my steps<WH6806>?
If I have walked<WH1980> with falsehood<WH7723>, And my foot<WH7272> hath hasted<WH2363> to deceit<WH4820>
(Let me be weighed<WH8254> in an even<WH6664> balance<WH3976>, That God<WH433> may know<WH3045> mine integrity<WH8538>);
If my step<WH838> hath turned out<WH5186> of the way<WH1870>, And my heart<WH3820> walked<WH1980> after<WH310> mine eyes<WH5869>, And if any spot<WH3971> hath cleaved<WH1692> to my hands<WH3709>:
Then let me sow<WH2232>, and let another<WH312> eat<WH398>; Yea<WH6631>, let the produce of my field be rooted out<WH8327>.
If my heart<WH3820> hath been enticed<WH6601> unto a woman<WH802>, And I have laid wait<WH693> at my neighbor<WH7453>'s door<WH6607>;
Then let my wife<WH802> grind<WH2912> unto another<WH312>, And let others<WH312> bow down upon her<WH3766>.
For that were a heinous crime<WH2154>; Yea<WH5771>, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges<WH6414>:
For it is a fire<WH784> that consumeth<WH398> unto Destruction<WH11>, And would root out<WH8327> all mine increase<WH8393>.
If I have despised<WH3988> the cause<WH4941> of my man-servant<WH5650> or of my maid-servant<WH519>, When they contended with me<WH7379>;
What then shall I do<WH6213> when God<WH410> riseth up<WH6965>? And when he visiteth<WH6485>, what shall I answer him<WH7725>?
Did not he that made<WH6213> me in the womb<WH990> make<WH6213> him<WH259>? And did not one fashion<WH3559> us in the womb<WH7358>?
If I have withheld<WH4513> the poor<WH1800> from their desire<WH2656>, Or have caused the eyes<WH5869> of the widow<WH490> to fail<WH3615>,
Or have eaten<WH398> my morsel<WH6595> alone<WH3490>, And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof<WH398>
(Nay <WH5271>, from my youth he grew up<WH1431> with me as with a father<WH1>, And her have I guided<WH5148> from my mother<WH517>'s womb<WH990>);
If I have seen<WH7200> any perish<WH6> for want of clothing<WH3830>, Or that the needy<WH34> had no covering<WH3682>;
If his loins<WH2504> have not blessed<WH1288> me<WH2552>, And if he hath not been warmed with the fleece<WH1488> of my sheep<WH3532>;
If I have lifted up<WH5130> my hand<WH3027> against the fatherless<WH3490>, Because I saw<WH7200> my help<WH5833> in the gate<WH8179>:
Then let my shoulder fall<WH5307> from the shoulder-blade<WH7929>, And mine arm<WH248> be broken<WH7665> from the bone<WH7070>.
For calamity<WH343> from God<WH410> is a terror<WH6343> to me<WH7613>, And by reason of his majesty I can do nothing<WH3201>.
If I have made<WH7760> gold<WH2091> my hope<WH3689>, And have said<WH559> to the fine gold<WH3800>, Thou art my confidence<WH4009>;
If I have rejoiced<WH8055> because my wealth<WH2428> was great<WH7227>, And because my hand<WH3027> had gotten<WH4672> much<WH3524>;
If I have beheld<WH7200> the sun<WH216> when it shined<WH1984>, Or the moon<WH3394> walking<WH1980> in brightness<WH3368>,
And my heart<WH3820> hath been secretly<WH5643> enticed<WH6601>, And my mouth<WH6310> hath kissed<WH5401> my hand<WH3027>:
This also were an iniquity<WH5771> to be punished by the judges<WH6416>; For I should have denied<WH3584> the God<WH410> that is above<WH4605>.
If I have rejoiced<WH8055> at the destruction<WH6365> of him that hated<WH8130> me<WH5782>, Or lifted up myself when evil<WH7451> found him<WH4672>;
(Yea <WH5414>, I have not suffered my mouth<WH2441> to sin<WH2398> By asking<WH7592> his life<WH5315> with a curse<WH423>);
If the men<WH4962> of my tent<WH168> have not said<WH559>, Who can find<WH5414> one that hath not been filled<WH7646> with his meat<WH1320>?
(The sojourner<WH1616> hath not lodged<WH3885> in the street<WH2351>; But I have opened<WH6605> my doors<WH1817> to the traveller<WH734>);
If like Adam<WH121> I have covered<WH3680> my transgressions<WH6588>, By hiding<WH2934> mine iniquity<WH5771> in my bosom<WH2243>,

Because I feared<WH6206> the great<WH7227> multitude<WH1995>, And the contempt<WH937> of families<WH4940> terrified<WH2865> me<WH1826>, So that I kept silence, and went not out<WH3318> of the door<WH6607>â€”

Oh that<WH5414> I had one to hear<WH8085> me<WH8420>! (Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty<WH7706> answer<WH6030> me<WH5612>); And that I had the indictment which mine adversary<WH376> hath written<WH3789>!
Surely I would carry<WH5375> it upon my shoulder<WH7926>; I would bind<WH6029> it unto me as a crown<WH5850>:
I would declare<WH5046> unto him the number<WH4557> of my steps<WH6806>; As a prince<WH5057> would I go near unto him<WH7126>.
If my land<WH127> crieth<WH2199> out against me<WH3162>, And the furrows<WH8525> thereof weep together<WH1058>;
If I have eaten<WH398> the fruits<WH3581> thereof without money<WH3701>, Or have caused the owners<WH1167> thereof to lose<WH5301> their life<WH5315>:
Let thistles<WH2336> grow<WH3318> instead of wheat<WH2406>, And cockle<WH890> instead of barley<WH8184>. The words<WH1697> of Job<WH347> are ended<WH8552>.
